question_text: Which of the following best explains why a 3.5-inch drive is more commonly used in desktop systems than in mobile devices?
answer_options: It provides higher rotational speeds, which reduce heat in mobile devices
It requires a SATAe interface that laptops do not support
It offers more internal space for platters and typically higher capacities
It is more energy-efficient and optimized for battery life
correct_answer: It offers more internal space for platters and typically higher capacities
explanation: 3.5-inch drives provide more surface area for platters, which allows for higher capacities than smaller form factors like 2.5-inch drives.
